question_title: What will be the value of "Nikkei Stock Average, Nikkei 225" on 2026-02-13?
summary: The Nikkei 225 is currently near 54,000, close to record highs. Japan's snap election on Feb 8 (5 days before resolution) is the major catalyst. PM Takaichi's 78% approval and polls suggesting LDP landslide support continued market strength, but risks remain (LDP party approval only 30%, precedent of 2024 election upset). Using the Nikkei 225 Volatility Index (34.33) to calibrate uncertainty and scenario-weighted Monte Carlo simulation, I forecast a median around 54,500 with left-skewed distribution reflecting election upset tail risk. The 80% confidence interval spans roughly 51,500 to 57,400.

factors.description: Nikkei 225 at ~54,000 near 52-week highs, strong recent momentum with record set Jan 14
PM Takaichi 78% approval, LDP expected landslide win supports continued rally
Takaichi pro-growth policies (fiscal stimulus, tax cuts) bullish for equities
Nikkei 225 VI at 34.33 (elevated) signals market expects near-term volatility
LDP party approval only 30%; 2024 Ishiba election precedent shows upset risk
JGB yields at record highs reflecting fiscal concerns, potential drag on equities
Global uncertainty (US tariffs, AI investment concerns) limits upside
